reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: WMD Commodity Identification Training Workshop. WMD Commodity Identification Training and WMD CIT Instructor Training. Technical Introduction to Licensing

description.narrative: Strengthen the global community's ability to safely destroy, store, apply safeguards to, and transport weapons of mass destruction (WMD) and secure related facilities and materials; control borders and territory to prevent illicit movement of WMD and related materials and technology and to prosecute and punish violators; prevent the proliferation of WMD and related materials, technology, and expertise to states or non-state actors of concern or to potential terrorists; comply fully with international obligations concerning arms control, nonproliferation, and WMD terrorism; deter and prevent WMD terrorism; and respond to a WMD terrorism event.

This award strives to strengthen the global community's ability to safely destroy, store, apply safeguards to, and transport weapons of mass destruction (WMD) and secure related facilities and materials. More specifically, this includes WMD CIT is typically a 2-3 day workshop intended to familiarize customs inspectors and others associated with enforcing or implementing export controls with WMD-related materials and equipment as identified on the control lists of the multilateral export control arrangements.. WMD CIT is typically a 2-3 day workshop intended to familiarize customs inspectors and others associated with enforcing or implementing export controls with WMD-related materials and equipment as identified on the control lists of the multilateral export control arrangements. Commodity Identification Training (CIT) Instructor Training workshops seek to build a solid foundation of knowledge in nonproliferation export controls, control lists, and WMD-related dual use commodities and processes; increase the familiarity of trainers with CIT course materials, including delivery of practice presentations; and provide for active discussions of CIT curriculum development, implementation best practices and lessons learned.. The course provides a strong foundation for newly-developing licensers by 1) familiarizing participants with the structure and content of the EU Dual Use list; 2) enhancing technical knowledge of selected controlled commodities; 3) discussing methods and resources for assessing the proliferation risks of proposed transfers; and 4) offering hands-on practice with commodity classification and hypothetical license applications..

participating-org.narrative: Department of Energy - Office on Nonproliferation and Arms Control
The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S.-Moroccan relations remain strong and our cooperation continues to expand. Morocco welcomes active U.S. cooperation in the political, security, economic, and cultural spheres. While current security concerns include the impact of regional instability on Morocco, Morocco is supportive of U.S. policy priorities globally and serves as a host and leader for many regional cooperation activities and events. On the domestic political scene, Morocco continues to pursue democratic and economic reforms.However, the pace and scope of Morocco's economic reforms remain uneven. Although inflation remains relatively low and growth rates hover near four percent, Morocco's economic situation is complicated by continued low growth in Europe, its main trading partner; an oversized public sector; significant youth unemployment; persistent issues with the quality of education; and broad subsidies for food and fuel. To address these issues, U.S. bilateral assistance will support economic growth and youth employability, educational advancements, robust civil society institutions, and stronger security institutions.
